tit.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 五重塔（ごじゅうのとう）は仏塔の形式の一つ。
sen.e: The Gojunoto is one of the styles of Buddhist pagoda.
The Gojunoto is one of the styles of Buddhist pagodas.
The Gojunoto is one of the styles of Buddhist pagodas.

sen.j: 仏塔には多くの種類があるが、このうち、「層塔」と呼ぶ楼閣形式のもので、五重の屋根をもつものを「五重塔」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The Buddhist pagoda, of many kinds, that is in the Rokaku (pavilion) style called 'Soto' with five-layered roofs is called 'Gojunoto (five-story pagoda).'
Buddhist pagodas, of many types, in the Rokaku (pavilion) style called 'Soto' with five roofs are called 'Gojunoto (five-story pagoda).'
Buddhist pagodas, of many types, in the Rokaku (pavilion) style called 'Soto' with five roofs are called 'Gojunoto' (five-storey pagoda).

sen.j: 仏塔は、古代インドにおいて仏舎利（釈迦の遺骨）を祀るために紀元前3世紀頃から造られ始めたストゥーパに起源をもつ。
sen.e: The Buddhist pagoda has its roots in the stupa that began being made to worship Busshari (Buddha's relics) in ancient India in the third century B.C.
The Buddhist pagoda has its roots in the stupa that was made to worship Busshari (Buddha's relics) in ancient India in the third century B.C.
The Buddhist pagoda has its roots in the stupa that was made to worship Busshari (Buddha's relics) in ancient India in the third century B.C.
sen.cmt: 余分な改行をのぞきました。

sen.j: 古代インドのストゥーパは饅頭形（半球形）のものであったが、この形式が中国に伝えられると、楼閣建築の形式を取り入れて高層化するようになった。
sen.e: A stupa in ancient India was a hemispherical mound, and its style spread to China to become multi-story architecture taking on the style of Rokaku.
A stupa in ancient India was a hemispherical mound, and its style spread to China to become multi-story architecture taking on the style of Rokaku.
A stupa in ancient India was a hemispherical mound, and its style spread to China to become multi-storey architecture taking on the style of Rokaku.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: こうした楼閣形の層塔は朝鮮半島を経て日本へ伝えられた。
sen.e: This Rokaku-style Soto was introduced to Japan via Korean Peninsula.
This Rokaku-style Soto was introduced to Japan via Korean Peninsula.
This Rokaku-style Soto was introduced to Japan via Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 木造の層塔は日本に多く残っており、中国、朝鮮半島における遺例はごく少ない。
sen.e: Many of wooden Soto remain in Japan, with few in China and Korean Peninsula.
Many of wooden Soto remain in Japan, with a few in China and Korean Peninsula.
Many of wooden Soto remain in Japan, with a few in China and Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 日本では、各地の仏教寺院や神社などに木造の五重塔や三重塔があり、地区のランドマークとなっているものも多い。
sen.e: Local Buddhist temples and shrines have wooden Gojunoto and Sanjunoto (three-story pagoda) in Japan, many of which are landmarks of their regions.
Local Buddhist temples and shrines have wooden Gojunoto and Sanjunoto (three-story pagoda) in Japan, many of which are landmarks of their regions.
Local Buddhist temples and shrines have wooden Gojunoto and Sanjunoto (three-storey pagoda) in Japan, many of which are landmarks of their regions.
sen.cmt: 余分な改行をのぞきました。

sen.j: 木造塔のほか、石、瓦、鉄製の塔もあり、近代以降は鉄筋コンクリート造の塔もある。
sen.e: Other than wood, they are also made of stone, ceramics, iron, and in the modern days there are ferroconcrete pagodas.
Other than wood, they are also made of stone, ceramics, iron, and in the modern days there are ferroconcrete pagodas.
Other than wood, they are also made of stone, tiles, and iron, and in the modern days there are ferroconcrete pagodas.

sen.j: 多層塔としては他に七重塔、九重塔、十三重塔などがあるが（層の数は奇数にほぼ限定されている）木造の七重塔、九重塔の現存するものはない。
sen.e: Although multi-story pagoda architecture also include Nanajunoto (Seven-story pagoda), Kujunoto (Nine-story pagoda), and Jusanjunoto (Thirteen-story pagoda) (mostly limited to odd numbers), wooden Nanajunoto or Kujunoto does not exit.

Although multi-story pagoda architecture also include Nanajunoto (Seven-story pagoda), Kujunoto (Nine-story pagoda), and Jusanjunoto (Thirteen-story pagoda) (mostly limited to odd numbers), wooden Nanajunoto or Kujunoto do not exit.

Although multi-storey pagoda architecture also include Nanajunoto (Seven-storey pagoda), Kujunoto (Nine-storey pagoda), and Jusanjunoto (Thirteen-storey pagoda) (mostly limited to odd numbers), wooden Nanajunoto or Kujunoto do not exit.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 奈良県の談山神社には木造十三重塔があるが、これは楼閣形の塔ではなく、二重から十三重までの屋根は密に重なっていて、屋根と屋根の間にはほとんど空間がない。
sen.e: Tanzan-jinja Shrine in Nara Prefecture has a wooden Jusanjunoto, but it is not in the Rokaku style, because its eaves of the second to the thirteenth roof are closely contacted leaving little spaces between them.

Tanzan-jinja Shrine in Nara Prefecture has a wooden Jusanjunoto, but it is not in the Rokaku style, because its eaves of the second to the thirteenth roof are close together leaving little space between them.

Tanzan-jinja Shrine in Nara Prefecture has a wooden Jusanjunoto, but it is not in the Rokaku style, because its eaves of the second to the thirteenth roof are close together leaving little space between them.

sen.j: 屋根の上にあるアンテナのような部分は相輪という。
sen.e: An antenna-like part on the rooftop is called 'Sorin' (a metal pinnacle).
An antenna-like part on the rooftop is called 'Sorin' (a metal pinnacle).
An antenna-like part on the rooftop is called 'Sorin' (a metal pinnacle).

sen.j: 中国の層塔は最上階まで登れるものが多いのに対し、日本の木造五重塔は、現代の感覚で言う五階建ではなく、内部は軒を支えるために複雑に木組みがなされており、上層に登ることはできないのが普通である（内部にはしごを有している塔もある）。
sen.e: Compared to many Chinese Soto whose top story one can climb up to, Japanese wooden Gojunoto do not allow one to climb, because they are not precisely five-story in a modern sense, but they have complicated timberworks inside supporting the eaves (some are equipped with a ladder inside).

Compared to many Chinese Soto whose top story one can climb up to, Japanese wooden Gojunoto do not allow one to climb, because they are not precisely five-stories in a modern sense, but they have complicated timberworks inside supporting the eaves (some are equipped with a ladder inside).

Compared to many Chinese Soto whose top storey one can climb up to, Japanese wooden Gojunoto do not allow one to climb, because they are not precisely five-storey in a modern sense, but they have complicated timberworks inside supporting the eaves (some are equipped with a ladder inside).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 現在では宗教と関係なく建てられたものもあり、また、模型なども販売されている。
sen.e: Today, some of them are constructed with no religious purposes, and their miniature models are sold.
Today, some of them are constructed with no religious purposes, and their miniature models are sold.
Today, some of them are constructed with no religious purposes, and their miniature models are sold.

sen.j: 塔が高層化したのは、境内に入れない一般の人々が離れた場所から参拝できるようにしたためである。
sen.e: The multi-story architecture was aimed to let ordinary people who were not allowed to enter the precincts worship from the distant.
The multi-story architecture was aimed at letting ordinary people who were not allowed to enter the precincts, worship from a distance.
The multi-storey architecture was aimed at letting ordinary people who were not allowed to enter the precincts, worship from a distance.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 代表的な五重塔
sen.e: Major Gojunoto
Major Gojunoto
Major Gojunoto

sen.j: 浅草寺 （東京都台東区） - 昭和48年、53.3m、塔院造り、鉄筋コンクリート、江戸時代建立の五重塔は浮世絵にも描かれ「江戸四塔」の一つとして親しまれたが、1945年の東京大空襲により焼失した。
sen.e: Senso-ji Temple (Taito Ward, Tokyo Metropolis): 1973; 53.3 m tall; Toin-zukuri architecture (Gojunoto built on Toin, or a sub-temple building with a cloister in the precincts of a temple); ferroconcrete structure; Gojunoto built in the Edo period was depicted in Ukiyoe prints and admired as one of 'Edo yon-to' (four towers in Edo), but it was destroyed by the Great Tokyo Air Raids in 1945.
sen.cmt: 塔院造り 参考 日本語(http://sikiyuu.sakura.ne.jp/390_asakusa/081018.htm)
sen.e: Senso-ji Temple (Taito Ward, Tokyo Metropolis): 1973; 53.3 m tall; Toin-zukuri architecture (Gojunoto built on Toin, or a sub-temple building with a cloister in the precincts of a temple); ferroconcrete structure; Gojunoto built in the Edo period was depicted in Ukiyoe prints and admired as one of 'Edo yon-to' (four towers in Edo), but it was destroyed by the Great Tokyo Air Raids in 1945.

Senso-ji Temple (Taito-ku Ward, Tokyo Prefecture): Built in 1973; 53.3 m tall; Toin-zukuri architecture (Gojunoto built on Toin, or a sub-temple building with a cloister in the precincts of a temple); ferroconcrete structure; Gojunoto built in the Edo period was depicted in Ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints) and admired as one of 'Edo yon-to' (four towers in Edo), but it was destroyed by the Great Tokyo Air Raids in 1945.

sen.j: 法往寺捌相殿 韓国 1626年再建 22m 韓国では現存最古で唯一の木造五重塔（国宝）

sen.j: 仏宮寺釈迦塔 中国山西省 1056年 67m 外観は5層にもみえるが内部は9層 中国で最大最古の八角木塔
sen.e: Sakyamuni Pagoda of Fogong Temple, or Okenmokuto Pagoda (YingxianMuta in Chinese): Shanxi Province, China; 1056; 67 m tall; its exterior looks five-story, but it is nine-story inside; the oldest and the biggest octagonal wooden tower in China

Sakyamuni Pagoda of Fogong Temple, or Okenmokuto Pagoda (YingxianMuta in Chinese): Shanxi Province, China; 1056; 67 m tall; its exterior looks five-story, but it is nine-story inside; the oldest and the biggest octagonal wooden tower in China

Sakyamuni Pagoda of Fogong Temple, or Okenmokuto Pagoda (YingxianMuta in Chinese): Shanxi Province, China; 1056; 67 m tall; its exterior looks five-storey, but it is nine-storey inside; the oldest and the biggest octagonal wooden tower in China
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Other

sen.j: 耐震性の高い塔の構造は「柔構造」の理論を用いており、近年、日本はもちろん世界の超高層建築に採用されている。
sen.e: Earthquake resistant towers use the theory of 'flexible structure'which is applied to the designs of super-high-rise buildings not only in Japan but in the world today.
Earthquake resistant towers use the theory of 'flexible structure'which is applied to the designs of super-high-rise buildings not only in Japan but in the world today.
Earthquake resistant towers use the theory of 'flexible structure' which is applied to the designs of super-high-rise buildings not only in Japan but in the world today.

sen.j: 但し、日本古来の五重塔や三重塔が持つ構造に関しては、まだ工学的には解明されていない。
sen.e: However, the secrets of the structure of ancient Japanese Gojunoto and Sanjunoto are not fully mechanically explained yet.
However, the secrets of the structure of ancient Japanese Gojunoto and Sanjunoto are not fully mechanically explained yet.
However, the secrets of the structure of ancient Japanese Gojunoto and Sanjunoto are not fully mechanically explained yet.

sen.j: その、心柱が独立していて他の構造体と接していないという構造の耐震性に関しては、忠実に再現された模型を使った耐震強度実験も行われているが、それでも、そのメカニズムは未だ明らかになっていない。
sen.e: The true mechanism of Gojunoto is not revealed yet regarding its earthquake resistance structure in which a central pillar stands independently without contacting other parts of the building, despite experiments on the quake-resistance strength of accurately simulated models are conducted.

The true mechanism of Gojunoto is not revealed yet regarding its earthquake resistance structure in which a central pillar stands independently without contacting other parts of the building, despite experiments on the quake-resistance strength of accurately simulated models are conducted.

The true mechanism of Gojunoto is not revealed yet regarding its earthquake resistance structure in which a central pillar stands independently without contacting other parts of the building, despite experiments on the quake-resistance strength of accurately simulated models are conducted.

sen.j: 明治の作家「幸田露伴」の代表作として、五重塔建立に一身を捧げる大工十兵衛の姿を描いた小説『五重塔』がある。
sen.e: A carpenter named Jubee whose life was dedicated to building a Gojunoto, is depicted in a novel "Gojunoto," one of the representative works of Rohan KODA, a novelist of the Meiji period.
A carpenter named Jubee whose life was dedicated to building a Gojunoto, is depicted in a novel "Gojunoto," one of the representative works of Rohan KODA, a novelist of the Meiji period.
A carpenter named Jubei whose life was dedicated to building a Gojunoto, is depicted in a novel "Gojunoto," one of the representative works of 'Rohan KODA,' a novelist of the Meiji period.

sen.j: 舞台は谷中天王寺の五重塔(通称、谷中の五重塔)をモデルとしている。
sen.e: Gojunoto in the novel is modeled after the Gojunoto of Yanaka Tenno-ji Temple (commonly called 'Yanaka no Gojunoto').
Gojunoto in the novel is modeled after the Gojunoto of Yanaka Tenno-ji Temple (commonly called 'Yanaka no Gojunoto').
Gojunoto in the novel is modeled after the Gojunoto of Yanaka Tenno-ji Temple (commonly called Yanaka no Gojunoto).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: この五重塔は関東大震災や東京空襲にも無事だったが、昭和32年7月に谷中五重塔放火心中事件によって焼失した。
sen.e: This Gojunoto survived the Great Kanto Earthquake and the Great Tokyo Air Raids, but was destroyed by the incident of arson-double suicide at Yanaka no Gojunoto in July 1957.
This Gojunoto survived the Great Kanto Earthquake and the Great Tokyo Air Raids, but was destroyed by the incident of arson-double suicide at Yanaka no Gojunoto in July 1957.
This Gojunoto survived the Great Kanto Earthquake and the Great Tokyo Air Raids, but was destroyed by the incident of arson-double suicide at Yanaka no Gojunoto in July 1957.

sen.j: ブルース・リー主演の死亡遊戯は五重塔に各階に敵がいて戦って登っていくというプロットの元作成された。
sen.e: In a film starring Bruce LEE, 'Game of Death' was made with a plot that the hero fights a battle with each enemy on each floor of a Gojunoto as he ascends it.
In a film starring Bruce LEE, 'Game of Death' was made with a plot that the hero fights a battle with each enemy on each floor of a Gojunoto as he ascends it.
In a film starring Bruce LEE, Game of Death was made with a plot that the hero fights a battle with each enemy on each floor of a Gojunoto as he ascends it.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 多肉植物（アロエなど肉の厚い植物）でユリ科ハオルチア(Haworthia)属に五重塔という植物がある。
sen.e: There is a species of plant called 'Gojunoto' (Haworthia Viscosa, Liliaceae family) which is a succulent plant (a plant with fat leaves, such as Aloe).
There is a species of plant called 'Gojunoto' (Haworthia Viscosa, Liliaceae family) which is a succulent plant (a plant with fat leaves, such as Aloe).
There is a species of plant called Gojunoto (Haworthia Viscosa, Liliaceae family) which is a succulent plant (a plant with fat leaves, such as Aloe).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 用語としては五重塔が正しい表記であるが、寺配布のパンフレットにおいても五重の塔と表記されていることがある。
sen.e: Although its correct notation is '五重塔'in Japanese (Gojunoto), brochures of some temples show a notation '五重の塔'(Goju no To).
Although its correct notation is '五重塔'in Japanese (Gojunoto), brochures of some temples show a notation '五重の塔'(Goju no To).
Although its correct notation is Gojunoto '五重塔' in Chinese characters, brochures of some temples show a notation '五重の塔.'

sen.j: （グーグルによる検索結果（平成18年8月）五重塔50.5万件 五重の塔9.6万件）
